results.title: What Caused the Chaos at Southwest
results.abstract: While carriers like Delta, American Airlines and United bounced back after severe winter weather wreaked havoc on holiday travel, the low-cost carrier canceled thousands of flights. Here’s why.

media.caption: Passengers at Southwest Airlines at Los Angeles International Airport on Tuesday.

results.title: George Santos Faces Federal and Local Investigations, and Public Dismay
results.abstract: Prosecutors said on Wednesday that they would examine Mr. Santos, who has admitted lying about his work and educational history during his campaign.

media.caption: Representative-elect George Santos at a political rally this fall. Mr. Santos faces questions over whether he lied about key parts of his biography.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Subpoenas;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Trump, Donald J;Thompson, Bennie G;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.title: Jan. 6 Committee Withdraws Its Subpoena of Trump
results.abstract: With the panel wrapping up its work in the final days before a new Congress, it has also pulled back its subpoenas for other witnesses.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: The House Jan. 6 panel had directed Mr. Trump to produce an extensive list of documents and communications related to his effort to invalidate the 2020 election.
media.copyright: Jason Andrew for The New York Times

results.title: The Best Way to Comfort Someone When They’re Sad
results.abstract: A limited yet growing body of research suggests that one of the most powerful ways to support someone is also the simplest: Start a conversation.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Fashion and Apparel;Shopping and Retail;Westwood, Vivienne;McLaren, Malcolm;London (England)
results.title: Vivienne Westwood, 81, Dies; Brought Provocative Punk Style to High Fashion
results.abstract: The London shop she ran with Malcolm McLaren defined an era. “I don’t think punk would have happened,” Chrissie Hynde said, “without Vivienne and Malcolm.”

media.caption: The designer Vivienne Westwood at her boutique in London in 1977. The shop went through many name changes; it was known as Seditionaries at the time.

results.adx_keywords: Assaults;Race and Ethnicity;Black People;Apartheid (Policy);Men and Boys;Cape Town (South Africa)
results.title: White Men Charged in Attack on Black Teenagers at Pool in South Africa
results.abstract: Two youths who tried to use a pool at a resort on Christmas Day said they were told it was for “white people only.” The violent encounter led to a charge of attempted murder and a call by the president to battle racism.

results.title: Its Reputation in Tatters, Southwest Aims to Resume Normal Schedule on Friday
results.abstract: Nearly a week after a winter storm upended holiday travel across the U.S., the airline says it is close to resuming service “with minimal disruptions.”

results.byline: By Kate Conger, Ryan Mac and Mike Isaac
results.title: What’s Gone at Twitter? A Data Center, Janitors, Some Toilet Paper.
results.abstract: Elon Musk has reduced the company to a bare-bones operation, and employees are under a “zero-based budgeting” mandate to justify any spending.

media.caption: Elon Musk is looking for even more ways to cut costs at Twitter. After stopping some rent payments, the company is facing eviction from its Seattle offices.

results.title: Congressional Inquiry into Alzheimer’s Drug Faults Its Maker and F.D.A.
results.abstract: The report said the F.D.A.’s approval process for Aduhelm was “rife with irregularities” and criticized Biogen for setting an “unjustifiably high price.”
org_facet: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

media.caption: The investigation found that Biogen, Aduhelm’s manufacturer, initially priced the drug at $56,000 a year because it wanted a “blockbuster” that would “establish Aduhelm as one of the top pharmaceutical launches of all time,” according to documents.

results.abstract: For some travelers, nothing can kill that premium-cabin buzz quicker than an infant next to them. But for parents, despite the overwhelming opposition (and glaring side-eye), seats in the front of the plane can be golden.
